meanings.definition: Done, spoken, performed, etc., without special advance preparation; impromptu.
meanings.sent1: The extemporarily speech surprised everyone with its spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: She gave an extemporarily response to the unexpected question.
meanings.sent3: The extemporarily decision to have a picnic in the rain turned out to be fun.
meanings.sent4: His extemporarily dance moves on the stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The extemporarily drawn doodle on the napkin became a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Made for the occasion, as a shelter.
meanings.sent1: The extemporarily built hut provided temporary refuge during the storm.
meanings.sent2: They set up an extemporarily tent for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: The extemporarily constructed treehouse was a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: The extemporarily assembled gazebo added charm to the garden party.
meanings.sent5: The extemporarily crafted lean-to kept them dry during the camping trip.
